channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for GA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for GA

item.title: Report X-2024030868
item.description:
Report X-2024030868

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-26T15:10:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-14
  • City: WAYCROSS
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was loaded into the trailer and crushed by other boxes loaded in the same trailer. DescribePack: The metal pail was crushed on the side. There is a small hole at the lid at the top of the pail. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: No injuries. Immediate clean up.

item.title: Report E-2024030457
item.description:
Report E-2024030457

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-25T15:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-21
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NAT experienced a UN2927 Nufarm Diquat SPC 2L release from a box containing (4) 1-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to a 1’ x 1’ area of the trailer floor and a 1’ x 1’ area of the concrete dock floor due to a pallet nail puncture. The damaged box of jugs, absorbents used to clean the release, and PPE were all collected into a 35-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage

item.title: Report E-2024030452
item.description:
Report E-2024030452

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-25T15:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-18
  • City: KENNESAW
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 18, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon jug of UN1760 was missing a lid and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES deployed neutralizing, granular absorbents to the released product and swept them up with hand tools. One (1) 55-gallon drum that contained the one (1) impacted 5-gallon jug, and one (1) 5-gallon bucket that contained the impacted cardboard and any neutralized product were generated as waste, labeled appropriately, and staged in the terminal's waste holding room.

item.title: Report E-2024030363
item.description:
Report E-2024030363

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-21T15:13:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-15
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO notified ERTS regarding one punctured carboy containing hazardous product, CHEM-AQUA 65605, resulting from a forklift puncture. A Contractor estimated that 2-gallons of product released onto the wooden trailer floor and 2-gallons of product released onto the concrete dock floor. Baking soda was used to neutralize the spill and two drums of waste were generated for disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by the incident.

item.title: Report E-2024030356
item.description:
Report E-2024030356

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-21T15:13:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-11
  • City: TUCKER
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 11, 2024, two (2) 5-gallon pails of UN2054 were damaged during transit due to lack of dunnage and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN2054 impacted trailer floor and neutralized the product on the pallet. FCE deconstructed the pallet and restacked the remaining intact freight for further transport. All spent absorbents and neutralized debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon metal open-top drum for further handling. The two (2) damaged metal pails were placed into one (1) 55-gallon metal open top drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024030675
item.description:
Report X-2024030675

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-27T15:12:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-26
  • City: Irondale
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Norfolk Southern
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Norfolk Southern personnel reported a possible leaking tank car at Norris Yard. Mechanical personnel on scene noted a strong odor near tank car GLNX23581. Upon inspection by a contractor, the source of the odor was the manway. The manway was venting as the result of not having a manway gasket. A manway gasket was installed and the car was released to transportation.
